Title: Over 600,000 minifridges recalled
Summary: USA: Over 600,000 Frigidaire-brand minifridges have been recalled in the USA after reports of short circuits causing more than $700,000 of property damage.

Title: AC users warned of risks after wildfires
Summary: SPAIN: With firefighters continuing to battle 14 major blazes across Spain, home and business owners are being advised of precautions to take with their air conditioning systems.

Title: Fourth person dies in New York LD outbreak
Summary: USA: A fourth person is reported to have died from the outbreak of legionnaires’ disease in New York City's Harlem neighbourhood.

Title: GE pledges $3bn US investment
Summary: USA: GE Appliances has revealed that it will invest more than $3bn over the next five years in its US operations.

Title: Samsung approves Chemours immersion cooling fluid
Summary: USA: Chemours has revealed that its Opteon two-phase immersion cooling fluid has been qualified by Samsung Electronics, following testing by the Korean computer manufacturer.

Title: Triton sells Kelvion to Apollo funds
Summary: GERMANY: US asset management firm Apollo is to acquire a majority stake in German heat exchanger products manufacturer Kelvion.

Title: Trane Technologies launches BrainBox AI Lab
Summary: IRELAND: Trane Technologies has announced the launch of the BrainBox AI Lab to serve as a hub for research into furthering intelligent, efficient and sustainable building operations.

Title: Stallion plans R32 plant in Rajasthan
Summary: INDIA: Stallion India Fluorochemicals, a Mumbai-based supplier of refrigerants, is to build a $13.7m R32 plant in the Bhilwara district of Rajasthan.

Title: Kelvion expands to meet data centre demand
Summary: GERMANY: Kelvion has announced the addition of 55,000m² of new production space at its factories in Tulsa, Oklahoma and Opole, Poland, to support demand for data centre cooling solutions.

Title: Daikin heat pumps for Ukrainian schools
Summary: BELGIUM: Daikin Europe has supplied heat pump systems, air conditioners, and air purifiers to schools in Ukraine to help rebuild critical public infrastructure damaged by the war.

Title: Aira announces further €150m investment
Summary: SWEDEN: Swedish heat pump company Aira has announced a further €150m of equity financing expand its European to operations and launch new innovations.

Title: Network Rail trials passive cooling system
Summary: UK: A new passive cooling system, currently being deployed in railway signalling cabinets to combat excessive heat, could improve the efficiency of commercial refrigeration cabinets.

Title: Williams’ employees celebrate 190 years
Summary: UK: Long-service awards have been made to eight employees who have given 190 years of service at Williams Refrigeration.

Title: Prizes for outstanding Adaptation papers
Summary: UK: Institute of Refrigeration president, Lisa-Jayne Cook, has presented certificates and prizes for three research papers presented by students at this week’s Adaptation 2025 conference in Manchester.

Title: Lib Dems call to heatproof the NHS
Summary: UK: With an increasing number of heat related deaths amongst older people, the Liberal Democrat party has called on the UK government to ensure all care homes are air conditioned.

Title: Daikin AHU meets healthcare demands
Summary: UK: Daikin Applied (UK) has unveiled the HTM-Pro T Series, a compact air handling unit designed to meet the stringent NHS HTM 03-01 ventilation guidelines for healthcare environments.

Title: Copeland scrolls for heat pump applications
Summary: USA: Copeland has announced two new variable-speed scroll compressor series for a wide range of commercial and residential heat pump applications.

Title: Total People opens in Wythenshawe
Summary: UK: Apprenticeship provider Total People has opened a new training facility in Wythenshawe to support engineering skills growth in Greater Manchester and Cheshire.
